contextId.quote: this truth comes from God's hand
Power is in the hand of their oppressors

contextId.information: "Do not let what you say cause you to sin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: Do not allow your mouth to cause your flesh to sin

contextId.information: AT: "to put food in his mouth" or "to eat" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
A person can see these things because he already has them. AT: "what a person has" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This is another way of expressing what will happen in the future. AT: "what will happen on earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: what will come under the sun

contextId.information: AT: "What the king says is the law" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here the word "hands" refers to power and authority. AT: "under God's control" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here the word "hearts" refers to the thoughts and emotions. AT: "Human beings are full of evil, and their thoughts are madness" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: The hearts of human beings are full of evil, and madness is in their hearts

contextId.information: Here the word "heart" refers to the emotions. AT: "drink your wine joyfully" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: drink your wine with a happy heart

contextId.information: AT: "If a ruler becomes angry with you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: If the emotions of a ruler rise up against you

contextId.information: AT: "The things that a wise man says are gracious" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: The words of a wise man's mouth are gracious

contextId.information: AT: "As a fool begins to speak" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: As words begin to flow from a fool's mouth
